dialogue.text: Okay, girls! Listen up, because I’m only going to announce this once! And if you miss out, you’re screwed until next Christmas and have to donate your gift to a local charity!
Do we still have to donate our gift if we’re volunteering at a soup kitchen tomorrow?
Bitch, you ain’t even in this class.
I know. I just wanted to see if someone wanted to volunteer with me. It’s from 9:00 AM to-
Yeah, we get it. You have a heart of gold and hands of soup.
I wish I had soup hands. Work would be much easier.

Anyway, before I was blindsided by the world’s sweetest interjection, what I was {i}trying{/i} to say is that it’s getting late, so the time has come to start exchanging this year’s Secret Santa presents.
Now, as you may have noticed, the turnout for our party this year is a little...lackluster. So to the few of you who actually showed up, thanks.
I know I’m not your {i}normal{/i} teacher, which I imagine is exactly {i}why{/i} Christmas is a bust this year, but I still care about all of you and hope you have, like...a great holiday and shit.
To be completely honest, we don’t really have a {i}normal{/i} teacher. But I think I speak for all of us when I say “thank you for being here.” We’re all really happy to have you.
Except for all the girls who didn’t show up and clearly hate me, you mean. But thanks, Futaba.
Anyway, only half the class being here means that a lot of you are going to get snubbed. So I took it upon myself to bring a bunch of random cheap presents so no one leaves empty handed.

If you wind up getting jipped out of a present or...just want some free shit, help yourself to a box beneath the tree. But please be warned that a lot of it sucks since teachers don’t make much money.
Sounds to me like somebody’s in the mood to give back to the community! If you’re not doing anything tomorrow-
I am. Sorry.
Looks like it will just be Touka and me, then...
Guess so. But anyway, feel free to mug the absentees the next time you see them in school.
I had a feeling something like this might happen on account of your {i}actual{/i} teacher being MIA, so I’ve got a list of who owes who you can ask about come tomorrow.
But for now, feel free to start walking around and exchanging presents. Once that’s said and done, you’re free to either go home or spend the night. Sleeping bags are in the closet if you need them.
Are you staying here, Imani?
Hell nah. I’m going home and drinking myself to sleep. Your sister’s in charge once Secret Santa is over.
Soup kitchen duty for everyone! Yay!
Well, at least you lasted a couple hours before burying your face in another notebook. Good job, Nodoka.
Thank you. I haven’t exhibited this level of self control since the night you lost your virginity just a few doors down.
I did not {i}lose my virginity.{/i} And I’m pretty sure Rin didn’t either. But I guess I’m not really clear on the rules when it comes to how that works for lesbian couples.
Now, that is a philosophical question even {i}I{/i} don’t have a concrete answer to. Nonetheless, it was quite difficult not busting down the door and joining in myself.
Sure didn’t sound like you were having a tough time from our room.
Yes, well, {i}you{/i} try having a ten inch penis stuffed inside of you and see if {i}you{/i} manage to remain silent.
Please. I’d very much enjoy that.
{i}Ten?{/i}
Perhaps even larger. It was quite the spectacle, if I do say so myself. You should ask to see it now that you’re no longer dutifully bound to a girl you never deserved in the first place.
Not saying you’re wrong, but aren’t you supposed to be {i}my{/i} friend?
Do friends not admit to one another when they do wrong?
That is a genuine question, by the way. I’m still attempting to understand just what being someone’s friend {i}means{/i} as I am apparently not very good at it. Based on recent history, at least.
You and Futaba still at odds? Thought things were starting to get better.
She’s walking this way now, so feel free to ask her yourself. Unfortunately, I am busy uncovering the secrets of the universe, so I will not be able to assist.
Farewell.
Wow, you really {i}are{/i} bad at this.
Hey. Sorry to interrupt...but this is for you, Otoha.
For {i}me?{/i} Why?
Secret Santa. But I’d appreciate it if you could take it from me now so Rin doesn’t see me handing it to you and think that I’m betraying her.
Oh, yeah. Sure. But, like...shouldn’t you hate me now? It’s not a bomb in there, is it?
I’m not going to {i}hate{/i} you for not following through with a relationship you didn’t believe in.
Besides, it was a {i}mutual{/i} breakup. Right?
Oh...yeah. Mutual.
Futaba...thanks. You really didn’t have to do this.
Oh, stop. We were friends {i}before{/i} you two started dating. We don’t need to {i}stop{/i} being friends just because you broke up.
Yeah, but still. It was probably awkward having to buy this for someone your roommate’s probably been ranting about nonstop.

I mean, it could be worse. You could have published a book with all of my most intimate and personal secrets while not doing nearly enough to disguise the fact that the character is literally just {i}me.{/i}
Well, I suppose that answers your question, Otoha.
Futaba, about that — I get that you’ve known Nodoka way longer than I have, but please don’t think she did any of that to {i}hurt{/i} you.
Like, if you were around to hear the things she says about you when we’re alone-
Let’s not talk about that tonight.
Merry Christmas, Otoha. Merry Christmas, Nodoka.
Here’s to another great year.
Futaba, is Sensei’s penis {i}ten{/i} inches? Or eleven? I’m having trouble picturing it at the moment.
{i}Why?{/i} Why do you do this?
Simple. I’m making a timeline and I’m attempting to find out how much it’s grown. And Futaba has a great deal of experience with-
Wait, Futaba. You forgot to answer my question.
{i}How are you this dumb?{/i} Aren’t you supposed to be some kind of...super genius? What the fuck was that?
Hm...
I’m just going to circle my original answer of ten and make a note to revisit it in the future. I’m sure I’ll have plenty of opportunities once Sensei returns to school.
Oh my fucking god...
Wha...
Are you frickin’ joshin’ me right now? Cause I ain’t normally a fighter, but I’m takin’ you down if this is some kinda prank, Sana.
It’s not a prank...
My mom got me a new one for Christmas since...she knows I like games and...I didn’t have the heart to tell her she bought me one a few years ago as well...
So...since you like games and stuff too...I figured I could give {i}you{/i} the old one and...we could maybe, like...play together sometime?...
Um...Miku?...
Now, I ain’t sexually attracted to girls-
Uh...
But I’m about ready to make the same damn move Rin made on you earlier, Sana.
That...won’t be necessary?...
Prob’ly not. But it ain’t like I got the best track record when it comes to kisses and Secret Santa. Plus, goin’ after you would sure make Makoto a lot happier than my last choice.
You’re really makin’ me rethink some stuff right now. Wow.
That wasn’t...my intention...
Can I, like...{i}really{/i} have this?...
Cause even if it’s used, that thing’s way above the spending limit, ain’t it? You could’ve sold it, gotten me some cheap stuff, then pocketed the rest. Why you bein’ so nice to me?
Maybe I just...give special treatment to...people I can speak to at eye-level?...
Well...there ain’t many of us and...I guess we {i}do{/i} gotta stick together, but...{i}wow.{/i}
And I thought {i}Sensei's{/i} present was good.
I’m glad you like it...I worked extra hard on the bow since I don’t have the original box anymore.
It’s gonna be a shame when it winds up in the trash twenty minutes from now.
Yeah, but at least it got to look like a present again...
Yeah...{i}wow.{/i}
Ya know...you’ve come a long way, Sana. I’m real proud of ya.
Huh? What do you mean?
You’re like, way different than you were at the start of the school year. And I know talkin’ to people ain’t really been your strength since all that stuff went down way back when.
But you’re like a different person now. Ain’t sure if I’d call ya {i}outgoing{/i} yet, but I think you’re gettin’ there. And I’m happy to see you’re startin’ to fit in a little more.
I’m not...the only one who’s changed, you know. You’re a lot different than...{i}you{/i} were at the start of the school year too.
Like...I never would have imagined you...willingly wearing a dress to a Christmas party...
Yeah...to tell ya the truth, I ain’t sure I’m the biggest fan of wearin’ clothes like this. I’ve got a lot I still need to, like...figure out and stuff.
But it ain’t like I {i}hate{/i} it, you know? I’ve just always felt more normal in...yeah, I’m sure ya get the point. You’ve seen how I normally look.
Mhm. But I think you look really pretty like this. And I like whatever it is that’s causing you to change as long as you’re still happy.
Yeah...I like it too.
Maybe a little {i}too{/i} much.
Is it...something specific? Or...
Yeah, but...I ain’t really allowed to talk about it. I’ve already gone and blabbed to a few too many people, so I’m on thin ice.
Ah.
Yeah...sorry for not bein’ able to tell you any more. It’s just-
No, it’s okay.
I don’t need to know.
Not sure what I was thinking when I decided to bring this here.
Of course you wouldn’t show up....You {i}never{/i} show up anymore. You’ve stopped giving a shit about {i}all{/i} of us...
But {i}why?...{/i}
{i}What happened?...{/i}
Where did we go wrong?...
How do we bring you back?...
But most importantly...
What the hell am I supposed to do with these stupid tickets now?!
Hello!
Ah!
Oh...Yasu. Hello.
It appears that the darkness has begun to swallow you whole.
No, I’m just black.
We are all black on the inside — and only His light can save us.
Girl, I don’t even know where to start with that one.
Sorrow clings to the air around you, circling your body and consuming you as you fall deeper and deeper into the depths of despair. But I know something that will cure you- temporary as it may be.
I know you ain’t about to start preaching to me at a Christmas party, Yasu. Tonight ain’t the night.
Every night is the night when all nights belong to Him.
But He is asleep right now...and these worthless hands can not find the light on their own.
They couldn’t even spare the lamb they led astray.
Hey, question. The fuck you doing with a crab?
This is no crab.
Nah...that’s a crab, Yasu.
This is a gift.
I know you ain’t about to give me a crab for Secret Santa.
What is “Secret Santa?”
Yasu, what do you think we’re doing right now? Why do you think everyone is wandering around the room and giving each other presents? This ain’t your first rodeo. You should know this.
Your darkness is all-consuming. It entrances me to the point where I am unable to focus on the happenings of the rest of the room, for I know that I must cleanse you.
God damn. I really hope for your sake that you never leave this city.
There is no reason to leave this city, for He can not exist outside of its area of effect. And without Him, I am even closer to {i}nothing{/i} than I was the day I was born.
Yasu...just tell me what you want, okay? I don’t have the energy for this tonight.
I want to know why you’re sad.
For if I can not help, I can listen. And Touka says an ear is worth a thousand hands.
I’m having a hard time picturing those words coming out of Touka’s mouth, but I think I get what you’re saying.
I’m not gonna bother a teenage girl with my stupid problems, though. I’m just a little...temperamental right now.
I understand...My blood {i}also{/i} curdles in the springtime.
I...don’t think you do.
But the gist of it is this...
{i}There’s someone I want to see right now.{/i}
{i}And he feels further away than ever before.{/i}
{i}You poor soul...{/i}
{b}{i}I really do understand.{/i}{/b}
Imani’s affection has decayed by 10.
Yasu’s affection has decayed by 10.
